paragraphs.text: I was even more impressed at how strong the impact of the follow/unfollow tactic was. I grew the new followers pay day from ~23 to ~32 by just following some of the accounts I liked the posts of, and then unfollowing them again on the next run.

paragraphs.text: Brilliant work. I was trying to use Selenium for automated testing in work and it was nearly impossible to get it working for a hover menu. That was about 4 years, has it improved now? I would be interested to know your experience on this.

Such a great post, man. Love the authenticity and how clear you outline your strategies. Unfortunately, for a nontech person, I wouldn’t know how even to start using this. Any tips? (i.e. where do I put this code…haha) Sorry for the newbie question
paragraphs.name: 2a38

paragraphs.text: Hello!
paragraphs.name: c8a1

I have nothing in common with programming languages and all of that seems to be like a black magic for me. I’ve…

paragraphs.text:
Thank you, I’m glad you like it.
That’s a great idea. 
Before I looked into Python, I learned Java at the University, so I’m not really sure how easy it is for someone not having prior experience, but this https://automatetheboringstuff.com starts at the very basics and gives you some really good ideas on what to automate.

paragraphs.text: Regarding the issue of HTML layout changes I have an idea. Why don’t you try finding the tag elements and get the attributes and try to match your condition . It works though the HTML code structure changes.

c71e29b23660.title: If you take a look at the HTML of the Webpage, it’s really hard to find an anchorpoint for the…

paragraphs.text: If you take a look at the HTML of the Webpage, it’s really hard to find an anchorpoint for the elements since they are nested like 20 times. Most of the time the only anchor is the class name or combination of tag and class/id.
paragraphs.name: a558
